Name: The Principal
Description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
Rule: Whoever plays this card is a principal. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Principal
Description: You create and play a Principal Character (PC).\nYou narrate your PC's actions, reactions, and motivations. You are the final authority on what your character says or does.\n
Prompts: •Stay true to your character•Share ways for other players to help you have fun•Look for opportunities to advance your story•Support other players' stories
Rule: Whoever plays this card is a principal. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Facilitator
Description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
Rule: Whoever plays this card is the facilitator. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Facilitator
Description: You push the scene forward by directing the spotlight of attention from player to player in fun and fair ways.\nMove the spotlight:\n
Prompts: •toward a PC who's at risk or in danger•toward a player who hasn't acted recently•toward a player who has an interesting idea•away from a player who finished a cool action
Rule: Whoever plays this card is the facilitator. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Lorekeeper
Description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
Rule: Whoever plays this card is the lorekeeper. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Lorekeeper
Description: You oversee the background details of the game world. Defer to players whose PC's heritage, origin, or interests would supply answers to background questions.\n
Prompts: •Who was the greatest Paladin in history?•What languages might my character learn to speak?•When did the dragons disappear?•How does magic work, anyway?
Rule: Whoever plays this card is the lorekeeper. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Referee
Description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
Rule: Whoever plays this card is the referee. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Referee
Description: You adjudicate questions about the rules of the game, and make changes to the rules with the group's consent. Any player can suggest how to handle a rule, but you have the final say.\nExample rulings:\n
Prompts: •Is a given card applicable to this fictional situation?•How should a given card's text be interpreted?•Is it time to create a new card?
Rule: Whoever plays this card is the referee. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Storyteller
Description:
During play, you can speak from one of several agendas.
These agendas can be assigned individually to several people, or all given to a single player.
The agendas can change hands during the game. You cannot take an agenda away from someone else, but you can ask someone else to give up an agenda.
If you've been assigned an agenda, you are bound to speak from it.
Rule: Whoever plays this card is the storyteller. Flip for additional rules.

Name: The Storyteller
Description: The game also has Ensemble Characters (ECs), sometimes called Non-Player Characters (NPCs). You narrate their actions and reactions as antagonists, allies, bystanders, and so on.\n
Prompts: •Give ECs a name and identity•Find the essential humanity of every EC•Don't steal agency or spotlight from the PCs•Initiate actions that prompt a PC response
Rule: Whoever plays this card is the storyteller. Flip for additional rules.

Name: Challenges
Description: Use challenges to tune the difficulty of a situation. A risky combat scene might pose several challenges. A simple social encounter might pose only one challenge.\n
Prompts: •You're navigating rough terrain, and might fall or lose equipment•You're fighting or fleeing a dangerous monster•You're working with complex magic or technology that might malfunction•You're confronting an emotionally fraught situation
Rule: Flip for additional rules.

Name: Challenges
Description:
Any player may challenge a PC's action if success or failure are both interesting.
When your PC is challenged, you must generate a hit to meet it, like flipping a character card. If you don't meet a challenge, your PC's intentions are thwarted or complications arise.
The challenge must suggest consequences for failure. "Or else nothing happens" is not a challenge. The same action cannot be challenged multiple times.
Rule: Flip for additional rules.

Name: X-Card
Description: Continue reading:\n"And if there is ever an issue, anyone can call for a break and we can talk privately. I know it sounds funny but it will help us play amazing games together and usually I'm the one who uses the X card to protect myself from all of you! Please help make this game fun for everyone. Thank you!"\n
Rule: Lay this card at the center of the play area

Name: X-Card
Description: Start the game by reading this text aloud:\n"I'd like your help. Your help to make this game fun for everyone. If anything makes anyone uncomfortable in any way, just lift this card up, or simply tap it. You don't have to explain why. It doesn't matter why. When we lift or tap this card, we simply edit out anything X-Carded."\n
Rule: Flip for the remainder of the text

Name: Uncertain Crisis
Description: You may not flip any cards in front of you (e.g. Character cards) to generate hits.\nYou may flip shared cards (e.g. Plot cards) or draw/pick a new card (e.g. Condition card, Random oracle card).\n
Rule: Flip this card when the crisis is past

Name: Uncertain Crisis
Description: Some situations cannot be solved by skill or virtue, but only good fortune.\nWhen you encounter such a crisis, decide what it would take to escape it, such as leaving the area successfully.\n
Prompts: •A chaotic natural disaster, such as flooding•Navigating a complex and ever-shifting maze•Entreating with capricious spirits or divinities
Rule: Define the scope of the crisis, and flip this card

Name: Gauntlet Crisis
Description: No card in front of you (e.g. Character cards) may be flipped more than once to generate a hit.\nYou may flip group cards (e.g. Plot cards) or draw/pick a new card (e.g. Condition card, Random oracle card).\n
Rule: Flip this card when the crisis is past

Name: Gauntlet Crisis
Description: Some situations are grueling and exhausting, wearing down your reserves faster than you can recover. Sooner or later, something has to give.\nWhen you encounter such a crisis, decide what it would take to survive it, such as escaping an enemy or saving a friend.\n
Prompts: •A furious and violent chase•Survival in a hostile and dangerous environment•An extended and grueling magical ritual
Rule: Define the scope of the crisis, and flip this card

Name: Overwhelming Crisis
Description: Immediately flip all Character cards in front of all players to their back side.\nCards may be flipped back and used in the usual way from then on.\n
Rule: Flip this card when the crisis is past

Name: Overwhelming Crisis
Description: Some situations will wreck a character's plans and assumptions, or be so daunting they have no idea how to handle it at first.\nWhen you encounter such a crisis, decide what it would take to survive it, such as defeating an enemy or finding shelter.\n
Prompts: •Final boss fights•Being sent to a new world•Confrontation with divine forces
Rule: Define the scope of the crisis, and flip this card

Name: Courage
Flavor: "Emory! Fall back! This isn't our fight!" -- Tana
Description: Courage can twist into cowardice or recklessness. Not everyone knows the right time to run from a battle, or when a battle really needs to be fought. And not everyone is prepared to fight every battle they face.\n
Prompts: •Boast of deeds undone or make promises you can't fulfill•Run away to avoid getting hurt, physically or emotionally•Seek glory or vengeance
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Courage
Flavor: "It doesn't matter if I win. It matters if I don't try." -- Emory
Description: Courage is strength in the face of grief, pain, and fear.\nCourage lets you fight when afraid, speak when being shouted down, stand up when you're injured, or rebuke someone you respect.\n
Prompts: •Honor or pride must be upheld•Someone or something near you has already suffered harm•Nobody else can or will take the risk
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Charm
Flavor: "Listen, city boy. Stop talking or I'll cut your tongue out." -- Woody
Description: Some people can become enraptured by their own ability to impress and influence. They buy into the story they're selling, until reality intrudes.\nOthers see charm as deceit, and will trust you less.\n
Prompts: •Show off needlessly•Push things for the sake of pushing•Take advantage of someone's emotions
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Charm
Flavor: "I only came here to see you!" -- Basler
Description: Charm is about creating a bond with someone at will. You can get through situations with style, panache, or force of personality.\n
Prompts: •Perform with grace and elegance•Get by on audacity•Gain someone's confidence
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Instinct
Flavor: "So, he was a king's guard in disguise. He looked like a bad guy!" -- Woody
Description: Only fools rush in, and this time, you were the fool.\n
Prompts: •Interrupt a plan mid-execution•Misjudge someone's intentions or actions•Screw something up by impulsively acting
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Instinct
Flavor: "My eye watches the target. My hand lets go the bowstring. I do nothing." -- Woody
Description: Your heart, your conscience, a divine command, or something else outweighs reason when you act.\nInstinct lets you act when everything says to hesitate, when uncertainty overwhelms you, or when speed counts more than reason.\n
Prompts: •Take decisive action now•Get an immediate read on a person or situation•Leap into an opportunity
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Magic
Flavor: "The Power is much like the ocean. You can sail in it, or drown in it." -- Tana
Description: When called, the Power always comes. That doesn't mean you can always command it. Even familiar workings can have surprising consequences.\n
Prompts: •Face a cost you can't easily or immediately pay•Supply a rare material component or perform a ritual at specific place and time•Suffer a side effect or curse
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Magic
Flavor: "I don't know, I just felt ... something ... flow through me!" -- Tana
Description: The mystical, the eldritch, the arcane. The Power has many names. What do you call it?\nYou can achieve a variety of supernatural outcomes with magic, such as healing, curses, enchantments, and more.\n
Prompts: •Place the impossible within reach•Mingle the material and the symbolic•Infuse the ordinary with awe and mystery
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Secrets
Flavor: "You don't wanna know" -- Basler
Description: The problem with secrets is keeping track of who knows what. The value of a secret is lost once it's revealed. And some secrets weigh on the conscience.\n
Prompts: •Endure distrust from those around you•Reveal the wrong thing to the wrong person•Give yourself away at an inopportune moment
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Secrets
Flavor: "Basler, where did you get that knife from?" -- Tana
Description: You deal in concealment, stealth, and subterfuge. Your tools are things people don't want known, or weren't expecting. You could use hidden weapons, court gossip, cloak-and-dagger skulduggery, or the secrets of the heart.\n
Prompts: •Acquire something from someone else without their knowledge•Reveal something you've been concealing•Avoid detection or culpability
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Tech
Flavor: "The gizmo broke and I gotta fix it. Well, at least I have my tools." -- Basler
Description: Nothing works perfectly, especially new inventions that have seen more use than testing.\n
Prompts: •The gadget has unexpected side effects or fails to work at a key moment•A gadget malfunctions or breaks in interesting ways•People distrust or avoid your strange science
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Tech
Flavor: "This gizmo can pick any lock in the kingdom!" -- Basler
Description: You focus on science, technology, or artifice to get things done. This includes science like handguns or balloons, magitek such as crystal fire-rods, or alchemy such as healing potions.\n
Prompts: •Fight using advanced weapons or protective gear•Overcome obstacles by deploying a gadget•Gain advantage against those unfamiliar with your tech
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Training
Flavor: "Well, I can't pick locks with my fingernails, can I?" -- Basler
Description: Your discipline is demanding, and while your body is versatile and powerful, it can't compete with everything.\n
Prompts: •Face a problem that requires tools after all•Spend time honing yourself instead of accomplishing an important goal•Reveal your abilities to someone you'd rather not see them
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Training
Flavor: "The mind directs the body's power. I get it now." -- Basler
Description: Through exercise, mindfulness, and practice, you've learned to use your own mind and body as a tool.\nTraining lets you act with grace, power, and precision, or overcome mundane limits.\n
Prompts: •Use your body's abilities in place of weapons, armor, or equipment•Focus inner strength to resist torment or temptation•Gain an understanding of someone from how they move
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Wits
Flavor: "When I said people were gullible, I didn't mean me too!" -- Basler
Description: No battle plan survives contact with the enemy, but not all planners are humble enough to realize that. Getting by on the world can sometimes mean exploiting people, or seeming like you're doing so.\n
Prompts: •Misjudge the strength of your position•Overplay your hand•Make someone else pay for your victory
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Wits
Flavor: "The world is full of opportunities!" -- Basler
Description: Wits lets you make the most of everything around you. You turn difficulty into opportunity, find solutions within the problem you face, and look at situations in new ways.\n
Prompts: •Find a way to turn strength to or from weakness•Devise a plan to deal with a problem•Realize a useful truth about a situation
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Dreamer
Description: When the gulf between is and ought becomes too much, which will you choose?
Prompts: •Reject the real, denounce the realist•Forget that you have friends•Lose sight of your dream for a time
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Dreamer
Description: Tomorrow beckons, if you can fix today. You can't change the world alone. But you aren't, are you?
Prompts: •Remind someone of their best self•Light a candle to spite the darkness•Defy what's possible with what's necessary
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Guardian
Description: You control that which depends on you, and sometimes the weight grows too much.
Prompts: •Assert your authority•Cast suspicion too widely•Shut down your feelings or shut out your charge
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Guardian
Description: You feel responsible for something or someone else. Their need propels you.
Prompts: •Keep your charge safe from something•Identify and monitor a threat•Endure the unimaginable
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Opportunist
Description: There's only so much good luck to go around. Will you run out of yours, or take someone else's away?
Prompts: •Kick someone when they're down•Betray a trust•Let someone else pay the price
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Opportunist
Description: Life is unpredictable. When an opening comes, seize it. When a chance comes, take it.
Prompts: •Exploit or create a weakness•Employ misdirection or deception•Take a risk nobody else would
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Performer
Description: When anything you say matters, will you say the wrong thing, or for the wrong reasons?
Prompts: •Outshine or embarrass someone important•Draw unwanted attention•Provoke an unintended reaction
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Performer
Description: Through actions and words, you entertain, persuade, or transform people around you.
Prompts: •Embody grace, confidence, or poise•Inspire or incite people to act•Spark or manipulate emotion
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Quester
Description: That which is greater than you can also crush you beneath it.
Prompts: •Waver in your dedication to your quest•Shut others out of assisting you•Ignore mundane needs to focus on your quest
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Quester
Description: A vow, an ideal, a promise, a vision, a mission. Something drives you unstoppably onward.
Prompts: •Make the hard choices your resolve demands•Rally others to your cause•Find a way forward despite everything
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Rebel
Description: To be the worst of what they say you are. How easy to do it accidentally. How tempting to choose it.
Prompts: •Make everything worse for yourself or an ally•Fall prey to temptation or darkness•Spark conflict or dissent
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Rebel
Description: Your power, presentation, reputation, or history cause common folk to fear or reject you.
Prompts: •Use others' fears to your advantage•Surpass a limit or break a rule imposed by others•Make common cause with other rebels
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Soldier
Description: Life is pain. There's no reward for this, only the next battle. When will you fall?
Prompts: •Lash out at an easy target•Use your power selfishly•Dismiss the peaceful alternative
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Soldier
Description: Life is struggle. Everyone has to fight, all the time. What do you fight for?
Prompts: •Test your fate against an opponent•Make a sacrifice to turn the tide•Stand up when everything says to stay down
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Synthesist
Description: What or who will you unmake, in your goal of making something new?
Prompts: •Tear down something valuable or important•Keep something going at great cost•Overuse the same solution
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Synthesist
Description: You create, fix, and remix.
Prompts: •Make something new out of what's available•Repair or recreate something•Bring creativity to bear against a problem
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Cosmopolitan
Flavor: "Do these wagon wheels fall off often?" -- Emory
Description: You can mistake your breadth of experience for depth, and fail to hear wiser voices.\n
Prompts: •Overestimate your own wisdom or experience•Lose focus of people as individuals•Treat one person as representative of a whole group
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Cosmopolitan
Flavor: "The clear skies, the lure of the open road, it's perfect!" -- Tana
Description: You've lived among people from all over. Maybe you lived in a bustling city, or traveled the world.\nYou've learned to approach situations by understanding many perspectives.\n
Prompts: •Recall a story that inspires people to new ways of thinking•Bring a fresh perspective to a situation•Unite people by finding the common threads between them
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Industrious
Flavor: "Smells like cow breakfast" -- Basler
Description: Some situations demand inspiration, not perspiration. Other times, the reality of repetitive work can lull you into boredom, distraction, or despair.\n
Prompts: •Sacrifice tomorrow's hopes for today's needs•Demand someone else live up to your work ethic•Lose sight of something important
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Industrious
Flavor: "Take a deep breath of that farm air!" -- Tana
Description: You grew up among farmers, trappers, city laborers, or other folk who made their way by the sweat of their brow. Others expected you to carry your own weight.\nYou've learned to approach situations with direct, hard work.\n
Prompts: •Be sensitive to the rhythms around you--cycles of nature, or people's routines•Make do with what's on hand•Coordinate with others to get hard work done
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Insular
Flavor: "Everything's different out here. That's why it's called a cloister" -- Basler
Description: Your early life didn't prepare you for the variey of people and things the world has to offer. You might make a faux pas or ask an embarrassingly obvious question.\n
Prompts: •Violate unspoken rules or cultural taboos•Cause conflict through misunderstanding•Fall back on questionable assumptions
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Insular
Flavor: "This is all very different from the cloister" -- Emory
Description: You grew up secluded from the rest of the world. Whether you lived on a lonely mountain village, a religious retreat, or a city enclave, the ways of the outside world are a mystery that must now be solved.\n
Prompts: •Solve a problem using your peoples' ways•Ask naive but insightful questions•Reveal hidden knowledge or exclusive experience
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Mercantile
Flavor: "...For the right price." -- Basler
Description: You know that some people have wants and needs, that others can satisfy them, and that power comes from mediating between the two.\nIt's easy to get addicted to that power.\n
Prompts: •Compromise a principle or ideal for expedience•Put a price on service•Treat people as assets or commodities
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Mercantile
Flavor: "Welcome to the Labri Market! You can find anything here." -- Basler
Description: You grew up among those who live via bargaining: a city's markets, an ocean trade route, or the corridors of power in an embassy or castle.\nYou've learned to approach situations through negotiation.\n
Prompts: •Make a deal or haggle over details•Navigate a complex or ambiguous situation•Gauge someone's wants or needs
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Solitary
Flavor: "You've left yourself alone too long" -- Tana
Description: Without experiencing what other people in your life can do, you may fear what you need most from them: an outlet. When you act distant, others will reciprocate.\n
Prompts: •Accumulate emotional debt•Keep your reservations unspoken•Leave others behind to fend for themselves
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Solitary
Flavor: "I got this, leave me alone" -- Woody
Description: For much of your life, you've been on your own. You might have been orphaned or abandoned or kidnapped. You might have run away from home, or home might no longer exist.\nYou've learned to approach situations through isolation.\n
Prompts: •Shut out distractions•Present a reassuring facade•Keep moving even when hope is lost
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Strict
Flavor: "As opposed to ironclad thugs lording it over the peasants?" -- Basler
Description: Committing to a way of life can help you push forward, but make you inflexible and stubborn.\n
Prompts: •Refuse to adapt your code to new or difficult situations•See the world through a narrow lens•Disdain or punish those who don't conform to your expectations
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Strict
Flavor: "Knights should be glorious champions of honor!" -- Emory
Description: There's a right and wrong way to do things. Right? You might be from a noble family where things are done just so, or grew up cautious thanks to constant danger.\nYou've learned to approach situations through protocol.\n
Prompts: •Uphold a code of behavior in the face of doubt or weakness•Use the training or skills that led to your code's adoption•Inspire or counsel others using your code
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Underclass
Flavor: "When everyone hates you, it's hard not to hate them back." -- Basler
Description: Sometimes, circumstances push people to a breaking point. Other times, doing the right thing becomes impossible, and you're left with doing the necessary thing.\n
Prompts: •Lash out at threats to your ego•Build yourself up in the eyes of the impressionable•Run afoul of those in power
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Underclass
Flavor: "Nobody fights for people like us. So we fight for ourselves." -- Basler
Description: You grew up among people who were neglected or rejected by a surrounding society: criminals, migrants, or members of a mistreated minority.\nYou've learned to approach situations via pride.\n
Prompts: •Stand up for yourself and those like you•Rally the downtrodden•Obtain your needs through a social network
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Unfettered
Flavor: "Those who go their own way often find the path lonely." -- Emory
Description: Rules aren't always made to be broken. You can offend others, or even hurt them or yourself when you go where you don't belong or do what you ought not do.\n
Prompts: •Sabotage a subtle effort•Trample on a cherished tradition•Disappoint or frustrate a more cautious ally
Rule: Flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone.

Name: Unfettered
Flavor: "As a princess, I had power. As a ranger, I have freedom." -- Woody
Description: Whether a scion of privilege, the free-spirited offspring of tolerant parents, or a feral child in a mystic forest, you've always done what you saw fit.\nYou've learned to approach situations through force of will.\n
Prompts: •Force an issue or break a deadlock through action•Reject restrictions and break chains•Drag others along your unique path
Rule: Flip to get a hit.

Name: Character Cards
Description: To create a new PC, pick three cards: Focus, Role, and Origin. You can choose cards at random, or select them yourself.\nThese cards describe the traits that you want to spotlight during the game. Just because someone else has the Courage card doesn't mean your character isn't courageous, only that it's not going to be the quality you're focusing on.\n
Prompts: •Front: get a hit by flipping the card•Back: flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone
Rule: Other side is identical

Name: Character Cards
Description: To create a new PC, pick three cards: Focus, Role, and Origin. You can choose cards at random, or select them yourself.\nThese cards describe the traits that you want to spotlight during the game. Just because someone else has the Courage card doesn't mean your character isn't courageous, only that it's not going to be the quality you're focusing on.\n
Prompts: •Front: get a hit by flipping the card•Back: flip when a prompt is narrated by anyone
Rule: Other side is identical

Name: Condition Examples
Description: Conditions are a way to achieve success at a cost.\n
Prompts: •You take Disarmed to score a final sword blow•Another player suggests that touching the idol will leave you Magicked•Take Weakened to stay within the poison cloud•You're already Hurt, but you can worsen it to Wounded to launch a final desperate attack•Spend a scene being healed by a priestess to discard Hurt, or a week of downtime doing odd jobs to discard Indebted
Rule: Flip to see rules

Name: Condition Cards
Description:
You can take a condition to get a hit. Describe how. You can flip a front-side condition to worsen it and get a hit. Describe how. Players who challenge you can suggest conditions to meet it.
The condition is fictionally true and limits your actions. Other players can pose a challenge if a condition would interfere with something you do. Discard any conditions that no longer apply in the fiction.
Individual condition cards describe how to clear them.
Rule: Flip to see examples

Name: Wounded
Flavor: "It's...just a scratch..." -- Emory
Description: You've been seriously injured. Every step is painful, and it's hard to concentrate. You can't move very fast or fight effectively.\nWho or what holds you together until you can be treated? Will you have scars afterward?\n
Prompts: •You suffered major blood loss•You broke a bone•You were pierced by arrows, spears, or claws
Rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.

Name: Hurt
Flavor: "Ow! Watch who you carve up with that thing!" -- Basler
Description: You've been bloodied, bruised, stunned, or suffered some other temporary physical harm. You can't exert yourself too much without making it worse.\n
Prompts: •An enemy attacked you•You took a long fall or hit something heavy•You were in a natural disaster or magical calamity
Rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.

Name: Exhausted
Flavor: "The leaf dragon's toxin got me... Sorry..." -- Woody
Description: Your body is out of resources. You need rest, sustenance, or medication.\n
Prompts: •Extended lack of sleep•Starvation or dehydration•Serious illness or poison•Delerium or hallucinations•Burns or frostbite
Rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.

Name: Weakened
Flavor: "This forest goes on forever, Woody. Can we just stop a moment?" -- Tana
Description: Your body is trying to keep itself going, but is under attack or is being deprived. You can't push yourself too hard, and it's hard to concentrate.\n
Prompts: •Fatigue or sleep deprivation•Hunger and thirst•Poison, disease, or infection•Exposure to the elements
Rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.

Name: Indebted
Flavor: "I kinda told the thieves' guild I'd take care of something" -- Basler
Description: You have significant debts that demand repayment. Your creditor is watching,  and their rivals may offer you a devil's bargain to escape.\n
Prompts: •Carry out illegal or dangerous activities•Work with a rival or enemy to achieve a goal•Sacrifice comrades or principles to avoid punishment
Rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.

Name: Obliged
Flavor: "We will deal with the brigands, your highness." -- Emory
Description: You have a responsibility and face punishment for failure or delay. Discharging the debt may be expensive, risky, or troublesome.\n
Prompts: •Deliver an item or message to someone•Lean on an individual or group•Promise a favor later for a purchase now•Swear a magically binding oath
Rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.

Name: Pursued
Flavor: "They definitely saw us!" -- Basler
Description: You are being actively hunted by someone or something that wishes you ill. You must stay hidden, disguise yourself when in the open, and perhaps make dangerous deals with those who offer shelter.\n
Prompts: •Wanted posters or official notices•Guards raised an alarm•You're in enemy territory or surrounded
Rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.

Name: Wanted
Flavor: "I think they saw us." -- Tana
Description: Someone or something powerful or dangerous is seeking you out, and you'd rather not be found. You risk discovery from guards, spies, or informants.\n
Prompts: •You broke the law or offended someone important•Locals are suspicious•You attracted official attention•You're in a dangerous animal's territory
Rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.

Name: Cursed
Flavor: "That berry was delicious. Hey, who are all of you?" -- Emory
Description: A powerful and baneful magic has you in its grip. You might be forced to act in certain ways, or barred from acting in others.\nThe rules of the curse may be a mystery. You may suffer pain or great misfortune violating them.\n
Prompts: •Misfortune or calamity hounds you•A ban against doing some common thing
Rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.

Name: Magicked
Flavor: "If anything in the forest looks edible, it's a faerie trap" -- Woody
Description: A spell or other supernatural power has bound you. It might cause inconvenience, impose new rules on you, or alter your perceptions.\n
Prompts: •Charms, illusions, delusions, and deceptions•Magical prohibitions against entering or leaving a place
Rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.

Name: Transformed
Flavor: "Hey, that raven looks familiar... Basler?!" -- Tana
Description: You've been physically remade into something new by powerful magic. You can still function, but it's a big adjustment. Other people may react with fear, curiosity, or hostility. You may be unable to speak or explain yourself to them.\n
Prompts: •Polymorphed into an animal•Changed into a supernatural creature•Made undead or demonic
Rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.

Name: Altered
Flavor: "Don't let them peck you, or you'll croak with the voice of the Raven God" -- Woody
Description: Powerful magic has physically changed your appearance or abilities. You'll have trouble doing things you took for granted, but the new form may offer new advantages.\n
Prompts: •Animal traits like tails or claws•Limbs turned to stone or plants•Ethereal or elemental body
Rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.

Name: Ungeared
Flavor: "The flood washed away our campsite! Now what?" -- Basler
Description: Your gear or supplies have been broken, lost, or taken. You must scavenge for substitutes or make do with bare-bones replacements.\n
Prompts: •Equipment lost in floods or other calamity•Stripped of weapons by enemies•Magical tools disenchanted•Completely without rations or shelter
Rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.

Name: Undergeared
Flavor: "This is the last of our fresh water." -- Woody
Description: Vital gear has been damaged, or resources are running low. You must ration what remains, or improvise a replacement.\n
Prompts: •Blunted or broken weapons, low on arrows•Damaged or partial armor•Malfunctioning magical tools•Lacking food, water, or medicine
Rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.

Name: Impeded
Flavor: "I can't feel the grimoire! I can't feel ANY magic!" -- Tana
Description: A sense or faculty you normally depend on has been temporarily lost. You might have pushed yourself past a limit, or been affected by a disease or magical effect. You are unable to use the affected abilities.\n
Prompts: •Temporarily blind or deaf•Unable to cast spells or use other special abilities•A breakdown or dissociation
Rule: Discard by spending downtime attending to the condition.

Name: Hindered
Flavor: "This arm is useless for drawing a bow right now." -- Woody
Description: Your body, mind, or senses are in temporary disorder. You might have overtaxed yourself, or suffered from injury or stress. You may be in the grip of a powerful emotion or anxiety.\n
Prompts: •Loss of mobility•Blurred vision or dizziness•Shock or mental imbalance•Overwhelming emotion
Rule: Flip to worsen the condition and get a hit. Discard by spending a scene attending to the condition.

Name: Hit
Description: You successfully met the challenge! Narrate how it happened.\n
Prompts: •Luck or coincidence made it work somehow•You were carrying the right item at the right moment•Allies intervened in your favor•An important lesson from your past came to mind
Rule: Discard to generate a hit

Name: Random Outcome
Description:
You can choose to draw a card of this type to see if you meet a challenge.
The card will suggest ways in which the challenge was met. You can use one of these, or make up your own. If a card indicates that you missed, you may not try to meet the challenge in other ways.
You may adjust the ratio of hit or miss cards in this stack to reflect the difficulty of a given action.
Rule: Draw a random card from this stack, flip to see the outcome

Name: Miss
Description: You failed to meet the challenge! Narrate how it happened.\n
Prompts: •Bad luck or unhappy coincidence•Your equipment failed or you left something behind•Allies were thwarted, absent, or ineffective•Overconfidence sabotaged your success
Rule: Discard this card

Name: Random Outcome
Description:
You can choose to draw a card of this type to see if you meet a challenge.
The card will suggest ways in which the challenge was met. You can use one of these, or make up your own. If a card indicates that you missed, you may not try to meet the challenge in other ways.
You may adjust the ratio of hit or miss cards in this stack to reflect the difficulty of a given action.
Rule: Draw a random card from this stack, flip to see the outcome

Name: Ecstacy
Description:
Ecstacy, Joy, or Serenity.
With Vigilance: yields Optimism.
With Admiration: yields Love.
Prompts: •Who in the scene feels this emotion? Who ought to, but does not?•Should this emotion be affirmed, resisted, revealed, or concealed?
Rule: Discard and shuffle into related cards

Name: Emotion
Description:
Oracle cards can answer questions. Draw one card for a simple answer, or two cards for a complex one.
Use these cards to answer what someone is feeling, or what emotion a thing or event would spark.
Each emotion has two neighbors. You can use the emotion itself, or choose to mix it with a neighbor.
Rule: Flip to reveal an answer

Name: Admiration
Description:
Admiration, Trust, or Acceptance.
With Ecstacy: yields Love.
With Terror: yields Submission.
Prompts: •Who in the scene feels this emotion? Who ought to, but does not?•Should this emotion be affirmed, resisted, revealed, or concealed?
Rule: Discard and shuffle into related cards

Name: Armored
Flavor: "You know what metal does? Heats up. Fireball!" -- Tana
Description: Every armor has a weakness or comes at a cost, like making someone slower or something heavier. Not every armor's weakness is obvious, and finding it may be difficult.\n
Prompts: •Those protected have limited mobility and senses•Weakness to specific damage types, e.g. lightning•Useless if penetrated or lost
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Armored
Flavor: "My daggers bounced off that plate mail! What now?" -- Basler
Description: This encounter includes something important that is heavily defended. This could mean body armor of leather or metal, hardened barriers of stone, or wood, a protective aura of magic, a divine blessing, and more.\n
Prompts: •Ignore harm from inadequate attacks•Destroy weaker things that strike it or are struck by it•Stand in defense of allies
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Base
Flavor: "The tyrant king doesn't know about these secret tunnels" -- Emory
Description: While Bases can be big and imposing, their nature can work against their occupants. The bigger the Base, the more likely it is to hold something helpful.\n
Prompts: •Contain secrets about the plans and activities of its occupants•Hold resources, weapons, or captives•Include defensible choke points or hiding spots
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Base
Flavor: "That's a big castle..." -- Basler
Description: A Base can be a temporary encampment, an outpost, a secret headquarters, a wild animal's den, or some other protected space. You might need to find something specific, get in or out, or confront the occupants.\n
Prompts: •Bases can have numerous occupants•Traps, labyrinthine structure, or other clever preparations•Ways to cut off escape routes or confine interlopers
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Diabolical
Flavor: "Basler, stop cringing. He's not talking about you." -- Woody
Description: Evil hasn't won, though it keeps trying. Powers from beyond are bound by their own rules too, and can be defeated accordingly.\nCharacters who arm themselves with occult lore or divine blessings may circumvent or neutralize a Diabolical power.\n
Prompts: •Be susceptible to folk incantations or rituals•Recoil from the pure of heart•Flee to fight another day
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Diabolical
Flavor: "Back, foul fiend! Light will overcome you!" -- Emory
Description: A Diabolical encounter has the touch of evil. An actual summoned demon, a possessed victim, or a dark and malevolent force are all Diabolic.\n
Prompts: •Seek to corrupt or influence the vulnerable•Exploit moral weaknesses or dark secrets•Expose its true nature and hellish powers
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Elemental
Flavor: "They had some nice gemstones too!" -- Basler
Description: Each element has rules. Water flows. Fire burns, but not without fuel. Some elements can counteract others. These rules can be exploited.\n
Prompts: •Be vulnerable to their element's normal vulnerabilities or rules•Require a nearby source of the element
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Elemental
Flavor: "Earth sprites. They have the ore we seek." -- Tana
Description: Powerful forces of nature such as volcanoes, storms, as well as elemental entities.\n
Prompts: •Create, animate, or manipulate its element in useful or dangerous ways•Change the environment with aspects of its element, such as making rivers of fire or barriers of wind•Counteract an opposing element, such as fire vs. water
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Flying
Flavor: "Meet my best girl, Annette! A net, get it?" -- Basler
Description: Wings require energy to sustain flight and can be fragile. Magical flight can be counter-spelled. Turbulent air or nets can force flyers down.\n
Prompts: •Become entangled, trapped, or confined in ways that negate flight•Be unable to lift heavy loads or fly under difficult conditions•Suffer harm if they fall
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Flying
Flavor: "Did something just swoop overhead?" -- Emory
Description: This encounter includes something flying or airborne. Winged creatures, skilled magicians, and floating platforms can ignore earthbound attackers and require effort to reach.\n
Prompts: •Strike targets on the ground without risking counterattacks•Move faster than those trapped on the ground, or reach places they can't•See greater distances
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Gang
Flavor: "Sounds like fair odds to me. Have at you!" -- Emory
Description: The strength of a gang is in its numbers. Without a strong leader, the gang obeys its collective impulses. Individual members can be isolated and confronted.\n
Prompts: •Have competing impulses or mixed sympathies or agendas•Fall apart if a leader is weakened or shamed•Follow a new leader or impulse that better matches its agenda
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Gang
Flavor: "They outnumber us 5 to 1, folks!" -- Basler
Description: A group of beings bound together in common purpose. Gangs can be organized, like criminal gangs or military units, or informal groups like angry mobs or animal packs.\n
Prompts: •Surround or isolate individuals through strength in numbers•Shout down or bully a lone voice•Bring a variety of skills or resources to bear on a problem
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Hybrid
Flavor: "That thing was terrifying! Your kingdom is messed up!" -- Basler
Description: Not every hybrid has a perfect command of its own nature. Hybrids must also obey the rules of all their component parts.\n
Prompts: •Suffer the vulnerabilities of any of their contributing parts•Become confused by conflicting impulses or instincts
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Hybrid
Flavor: "A Gryphon. The heraldic symbol of my kingdom. Majestic!" -- Emory
Description: A Hybrid being is made up of two or more things, not always living. Such beings can be part-human (mermaids, harpies), mixed animal (cockatrices, pegasi), shapeshifters (werewolves), or weirder (tree-ogres).\n
Prompts: •Use the best of their combined abilities•Use different abilities together in some unique way
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Large
Flavor: "Just as long as it doesn't fall on us." -- Basler
Description: You may have trouble engaging with a Large encounter due to the size difference, but that trouble goes both ways. It can be hard for Large things to perceive or target smaller foes.\n
Prompts: •Lose track of small details or targets•Be easily targeted due to its size•Move slowly or clumsily
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Large
Flavor: "The bigger they are, the harder they fall!" -- Tana
Description: This encounter includes something of enormous size. It might be naturally large, like a dragon or a giant, or have been enlarged by magic or other forces.\n
Prompts: •Resist human-scale attacks or effects•Reach or hit an entire area at once•Deal devastating damage to smaller creatures and objects
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Monstrous
Flavor: "Whoever corrupted this creature will pay. Let's find them." -- Woody
Description: A Monstrous threat is powered by its rage or aggression, but often lack a sense of self-preservation, fighting relentlessly when others would retreat.\n
Prompts: •Lose themselves in their own ferocity•Fall into traps when goaded•Misunderstand those not driven by similar instincts
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Monstrous
Flavor: "That ain't no ordinary wolf, folks.." -- Basler
Description: Monstrous threats are altered forms of the familiar. They are fiercer, more feral, or disturbingly unnatural, the nightmarishly distorted vision of the original.\n
Prompts: •Lash out viciously•Use their adaptions to overwhelm the unprepared•Terrify onlookers with their awful nature
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Notorious
Flavor: "Save the beak. We need it to claim the reward!" -- Basler
Description: The stories about this encounter might give you clues on how to deal with it. But stories are just that, stories. You might correctly leverage its lore, or look at it with fresh eyes and discover a truth the bards omitted.\n
Prompts: •Behave or react predictably•Be less, or other, than the stories say•Be part of another unguessed story
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Notorious
Flavor: "That's Gretamaw, the Beaked Butcher!" -- Basler
Description: A monster whispered of by fearful villagers. A lonely place of power. An artifact of legend, replete with arcane power. A person sung of by the bards. The weight of its reputation or its followers may be as much of a danger as its own power.\n
Prompts: •Dominate with their presence•Live up to the legend in a big way•Reveal an unexpected ability
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Portentous
Flavor: "They're going the same way we are. Come on." -- Woody
Description: The Portentous is the first step on a larger road. It both surprises characters, and prepares them for what is next. If the future cannot be changed, it can be met with eyes open. And you will only know if fate can be defied by trying.\n
Prompts: •Reveal an important clue or suggest a strategy•Unlock a hidden strength or personal conviction
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Portentous
Flavor: "Where are all those crows going?" -- Tana
Description: This encounter foreshadows something important. It can be a mystical experience, laden with dreams and prophecy, or just a mundane glimpse into a momentous reality beyond.\n
Prompts: •Give a taste of things to come•Force people into hard moral or personal choices•Subtly mingle the mundane and the symbolic or dreamlike
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Spectral
Flavor: "I'll have a magic circle up in a moment!" -- Tana
Description: Spectral beings are only visitors in the waking world. Their anchors are tenuous, and they may leave if given what they want or be forced out by those who know how.\n
Prompts: •Be weakened or repulsed by warding rituals•Fall prey to their passions
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Spectral
Flavor: "My arrows go right through it." -- Woody
Description: This encounter includes something ghostly or purely spiritual. Spectral entities might have obligations or passions binding them to the mortal world. They may be frightened, angry, or confused. They might wish to go - or to stay.\n
Prompts: •Bypass solid obstacles•Wield morbid magics like chilling touch or possession•Ravenously pursue something the living have that it wants
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Tense
Flavor: "You mean the real villain all this time was...?!" -- Emory
Description: If you discover the reason for a Tense situation, you can find a ways to defuse it. You can talk others down if you aren't caught up in the situation yourself.\n
Prompts: •Overcome mistrust through negotiation•Reveal facts that counter false assumptions•Make compromises and sacrifices in the name of peace
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Tense
Flavor: "Deep breaths. Stay calm. Show them we're friends." -- Tana
Description: The encounter includes a highly charged situation. One or more parties might be on edge, ready for confrontation with another. Can you navigate it without making everything worse?\n
Prompts: •Lash out with ill-considered action•Make bad assessments or assume the worst•Heedlessly run away, often making things worse
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Toxic
Flavor: "My arrows can fly farther than its spit." -- Woody
Description: Some toxins have antidotes, or may not penetrate some kinds of defense. For example, a snake's fangs might be deflected by armor.\n
Prompts: •Inadvertently harm allies, or themselves if they are not immune•Be unable to deliver its poison if you find adequate protection•Fail to harm something or someone with a natural or acquired immunity
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Toxic
Flavor: "Don't let it touch you! Your skin will rot away!" -- Woody
Description: Venomous creatures, assassins with poisoned blades,  swamp gasses, and many other things can afflict you with sickness. Poisons can be fast acting and deadly, or gradually debilitating.\n
Prompts: •Sicken anyone in contact with them•Fend off an attack with the threat of toxin•Spread the toxin to others
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Undead
Flavor: "Not so much fell as fell apart..." -- Basler
Description: Being sustained by dark magic, the undead are equally vulnerable to it. Many cannot abide holy objects, places, or effects. Others are bound by orders to only guard a certain place, or do a certain thing.\n
Prompts: •Weaken or expire in the presence of the sacred or the pure•Fall prey to tricks or traps a thinking being could avoid•Have limitations its creator didn't anticipate
Rule: Flip to see ways the encounter challenges the PCs.

Name: Undead
Flavor: "This unholy abomination will fall!" -- Emory
Description: Necromancy, curses, or strange phenomena can bring a deceased creature back to a false life. The being is sustained by magic, not biology. Some undead are mindless; others are disturbingly cunning.\n
Prompts: •Ignore the frailties of mortal existence•Frighten onlookers with a reminder of mortality•Employ dread powers
Rule: Flip to see ways to meet the encounter's challenges.

Name: Artistic
Description: Two neighborhoods are connected via artistic expression. One's artists may be exploited by patrons from the other, or the artists are improperly borrowing from a neighboring culture. Two neighborhoods may have competing cultural and artistic traditions.\n
Prompts: •What forms of art exist in the city?•How does the city view those who make art?•Who is interested in collecting or commissioning art?
Rule: Flip to see the stable version of this dynamic

Name: Artistic
Description: Two neighborhoods are connected via artistic expression. One may house artists who draw inspiration or receive funding from the other. Artists of different traditions may cross-train, creating a new and unique tradition.\n
Prompts: •What forms of art exist in the city?•How does the city view those who make art?•Who is interested in collecting or commissioning art?
Rule: Flip to see the unstable version of this dynamic

Name: Criminal
Description: Two neighborhoods are connected via criminal activity, From petty theft and pickpocketing to smuggling to murder. Gang wars between rival factions, a single criminal mastermind, or open corruption are all possibilities.\n
Prompts: •What kinds of laws exist? Are they fair?•Who enforces those laws? How strictly?•How does the public view the criminal element?
Rule: Flip to see the stable version of this dynamic

Name: Criminal
Description: Two neighborhoods are connected via criminal activity, from petty theft and pickpocketing to smuggling to murder. Organized crime cartels, thieves' guilds, etc. from one neighborhood may prey on the other. Or legitimate business in one is being propped up by criminal activity in the other.\n
Prompts: •What kinds of laws exist? Are they fair?•Who enforces those laws? How strictly?•How does the public view the criminal element?
Rule: Flip to see the unstable version of this dynamic

Name: Commercial
Description: People from one neighborhood in the dynamic buy or sell goods and services to the other. Market prices are volatile, or there may be an imbalance in supply vs. demand.\n
Prompts: •Who gains from the instability? Who loses?•Where else can supply, demand, or labor be found instead?•How are people coping?
Rule: Flip to see the stable version of this dynamic

Name: Commercial
Description: People from one neighborhood buy or sell goods and services to the other. Advertising, word of mouth, or tradition might entice new visitors. Supply and demand are roughly balanced, or the market is adaptable enough to cope when they aren't.\n
Prompts: •Who pays whom, and for what?•Who benefits from the arrangement? Who suffers?•Who would like a piece of the action?
Rule: Flip to see the unstable version of this dynamic

Name: Esoteric
Description: Two neighborhoods interact through arcane goods and services. Although one needs what the other has, the exchange is threatened by mistrust, scarcity, or the volatility of the materials and processes themselves.\n
Prompts: •What kinds of things are exchanged?•What kind of people work with them?•How does the city view such people?
Rule: Flip to see the stable version of this dynamic

Name: Esoteric
Description: Two neighborhoods interact through arcane goods and services. One may supply the other's needs, or contain a natural source for something vital or valuable. Or both may contribute ingredients to complete a final thing.\n
Prompts: •What kinds of things are exchanged?•What kind of people work with them?•How does the city view such people?
Rule: Flip to see the unstable version of this dynamic

Name: External
Description: Two neighborhoods are connected by something happening outside the city. Whether people, things, or trends, life in the neighborhoods is being shaken up by it.\n
Prompts: •What is the external?•Is the city importing or exporting it?•Who benefits? Who doesn't?
Rule: Flip to see the stable version of this dynamic

Name: External
Description: Two neighborhoods are connected by something happening outside the city. This could be immigration, trade, religious or political action, cultural trends, or something else.\n
Prompts: •What is the external?•Is the city importing or exporting it?•Who benefits? Who doesn't?
Rule: Flip to see the unstable version of this dynamic

Name: Industrial
Description: Two neighborhoods are connected by the production of goods. Labor disputes, material shortages, sabotage, or technological progress can all make that process unstable.\n
Prompts: •What is being made? Processed metals, medicines, tools?•How is it being used? By whom? For what?•Who wants these things? Who doesn't them to be made?
Rule: Flip to see the stable version of this dynamic

Name: Industrial
Description: Two neighborhoods are connected by the production of goods. One may supply workers and/or raw materials for the other, one may buy what the other makes, or the two may cooperate in other ways.\n
Prompts: •What is being made? Processed metals, medicines, tools?•How is it being used? By whom? For what?•Who wants these things? Who doesn't them to be made?
Rule: Flip to see the unstable version of this dynamic

Name: Political
Description: Two neighborhoods interact via influence, and leadership. One might dominate another, depend on another for legitimacy, or prioritize or ignore the other. When the corrupt edifice falls, who will be beneath it when it finally falls?\n
Prompts: •Who is agitating for change? Who holds the line?•What outside influences are present? Who do they support?•Is the struggle physically peaceful or violent?
Rule: Flip to see the stable version of this dynamic

Name: Political
Description: Two neighborhoods interact via power, influence, and leadership. There is a long-standing arrangement or entrenched leadership keeping things stable. Enough people, or the right people, like things as they are and work to keep it that way.\n
Prompts: •Who benefits from the situation? Who suffers?•What keeps the relationship going?•How reluctant are people to acknowledge or confront the situation?
Rule: Flip to see the unstable version of this dynamic

Name: Social
Description: Two neighborhoods play off each other via fashion or pop culture. One may be trying to crush the other's creative efforts, or upstage the other in increasingly desperate ways. The results may be soulless, gaudy, or seen as needlessly aggressive.\n
Prompts: •What's in fashion now? What is out now?•How is fashion expressed, e.g. clothes, jewelry, music, tattoos?•Who are the trendsetters? Who are the rebels?
Rule: Flip to see the stable version of this dynamic

Name: Social
Description: Two neighborhoods play off each other via fashion or pop culture. The trends of the moment may shift between the two, or the tension between them may be what creates the magic. The results are disseminated through parties, performances, and gossip.\n
